options.label: B
options.text: It has no effect on the reflex

options.label: D
options.text: It increases flexibility but not strength

title: Can steroids save your life? - Anees Bahji

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason for the many different types of steroids?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they have different effects on the body.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are naturally occurring or synthetic.

options.label: C
options.text: Because the term "steroids" refers to substances with a shared molecular structure.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are used in different medical treatments.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of cortisol in the body?

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the body's immune response.

options.label: B
options.text: To decrease the body's immune response.

options.label: C
options.text: To signal the body to generate more glucose for energy.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of cortisol on the immune system in the short term?

options.label: A
options.text: It increases the immune system's ability to produce inflammation.

options.label: B
options.text: It decreases the immune system's ability to produce inflammation.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on the immune system.

options.label: D
options.text: It increases the immune system's ability to regenerate bone marrow and lymph nodes.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of medicinal corticosteroids?

options.label: B
options.text: To enhance the body's cortisol supply.

options.label: C
options.text: To suppress the immune system's ability to produce inflammation.

options.label: D
options.text: To treat allergic reactions, rashes, and asthma.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of long-term exposure to corticosteroids?

options.label: A
options.text: It has no negative effects on the body.

options.label: B
options.text: It can help keep the immune system under control.

options.label: C
options.text: It can cause negative psychological and physiological effects.

options.label: D
options.text: It can increase the body's immune response.

title: Axolotls are masters of regeneration

multiple-choice.question: Where are axolotls native to?

options.label: A
options.text: Mexico's Xochimilco link complex near Mexico City

options.label: B
options.text: The lakes and islands of Mexico City

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about axolotls compared to other salamanders?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They retain their juvenile features and remain underwater permanently

options.label: D
options.text: They are not able to regenerate limbs

multiple-choice.question: What is remarkable about axolotls' ability to regenerate?

options.label: A
options.text: They can only regenerate their limbs

options.label: B
options.text: They can regenerate their spinal cord, jaw, tail, and skin without scarring

options.label: C
options.text: They can only regenerate their skin

options.label: D
options.text: They can only regenerate their tail

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the green fluorescent protein in axolotls?

options.label: B
options.text: To help scientists see cancerous cells and how they spread

options.label: C
options.text: To help axolotls regenerate limbs faster

options.label: D
options.text: To help axolotls grow new eyes

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of the remarkable ability of axolotls to regenerate body parts?

options.label: A
options.text: They can regrow a new head from a cell sample

options.label: B
options.text: They can regrow a new limb from a few cells

options.label: C
options.text: They can regrow a new tail from a cell sample

options.label: D
options.text: They can regrow a new eye from a cell sample

options.label: A
options.text: An honest person is more likely to be cooperative and enthusiastic, while a deceptive person is more likely to be withdrawn and lower their voice

options.label: B
options.text: An honest person is more likely to be withdrawn and lower their voice, while a deceptive person is more likely to be cooperative and enthusiastic

options.label: C
options.text: An honest person is more likely to pepper their account with irrelevant details, while a deceptive person is more likely to tell their story in strict chronological order

options.label: D

title: How fast can a vaccine be made? - Dan Kwartler

multiple-choice.question: How quickly can vaccine development generally take under regular circumstances?

options.label: A
options.text: To find a safe way to introduce our immune system to the virus or bacteria

options.label: C
options.text: To directly apply heat, acid, or radiation to weaken the pathogen

options.label: D
options.text: To inject harmless fragments of viral proteins

multiple-choice.question: What is the main advantage of inactivated vaccines compared to traditional attenuated vaccines?

options.label: B
options.text: They rely on weakened viral strains that must be cultivated in non-human tissue over long periods of time

options.label: C
options.text: They directly apply heat, acid, or radiation to weaken the pathogen

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary challenge in clinical testing, and how is it typically addressed?

options.label: A
options.text: The challenge is to speed up the process, and it is typically addressed by running multiple trials within one phase at the same time

options.label: B
options.text: The challenge is to determine the right dosage and delivery schedule, and it is typically addressed by leveraging previously approved treatments

options.label: C
options.text: The challenge is to establish that the vaccine is safe and effective, and it is typically addressed by running multiple trials within one phase at the same time

options.label: D
options.text: The challenge is to determine safety across the vaccine’s primary use population, and it is typically addressed by leveraging previously approved treatments

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential breakthrough that could dramatically expedite all three stages of vaccine production?

options.label: D
options.text: DNA and mRNA based vaccines that could swap genetic material from different viruses into the same vaccine design

title: Home sweet habitat: Crash Course Kids

multiple-choice.question: What is a habitat?

options.label: A
options.text: A place where animals go to escape the cold.

options.label: B
options.text: The area where something lives, and the living and non-living things around it that it relies on to survive.

options.label: C
options.text: A food chain that includes every plant and animal in a habitat.

options.label: D
options.text: A type of animal that lives in the Arctic.

multiple-choice.question: What do animals need to survive in their habitat?

options.label: B
options.text: Food, water, shelter, and space to live.

options.label: C
options.text: Only shelter and space to live.

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between a food chain and a food web?

options.label: A
options.text: A food chain has many different plants and animals, while a food web has only one type of plant and animal.

options.label: B
options.text: A food chain is a model used to describe the flow of energy between living things, while a food web is a big, tangled system that includes every plant and animal in a habitat.

options.label: C
options.text: A food chain is a big, tangled system that includes every plant and animal in a habitat, while a food web is a model used to describe the flow of energy between living things.

options.label: D
options.text: A food chain and a food web are the same thing.

multiple-choice.question: What is a decomposer?

options.label: A
options.text: An animal that eats other animals.

options.label: B
options.text: A plant that converts energy from the sun.

options.label: C
options.text: An insect, fungus, or bacteria that breaks down matter and provides nutrients for plants.

options.label: D
options.text: A type of animal that lives in the Arctic.

multiple-choice.question: Why is it difficult for a polar bear to survive in the desert?

options.label: C
options.text: Because it does not fit into its food web perfectly.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it does not fit into its habitat perfectly.

options.label: C
options.text: A process by which babies focus more on human faces and less on monkey faces.

title: Which voting system is the best? - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: Imagine we want to build a new space port at one of four recently settled Martian bases, and are holding a vote to determine its location. What is the fairest way to conduct that vote?

options.label: A
options.text: Plurality voting, or "first past the post."

options.label: B
options.text: Instant runoff voting, which accounts for the full range of people's preferences rather than just their top choices.

options.label: C
options.text: Voting in multiple rounds, with the top two winners proceeding to a separate runoff.

options.label: D
options.text: The Condorcet method, which lets voters express a preference in every possible head-to-head matchup.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main problem with the Condorcet method?

options.label: A
options.text: It is too complex and difficult to understand.

options.label: B
options.text: It fails to select a winner in elections with three or more candidates.

options.label: C
options.text: It gives too much influence to minority voters.

options.label: D
options.text: It is biased towards certain geographic locations.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the problem with plurality voting?

options.label: A
options.text: It is too time-consuming and takes too long to count votes.

options.label: B
options.text: It gives too much influence to minority voters.

options.label: C
options.text: It does not take into account the full range of people's preferences.

options.label: D
options.text: It can lead to an unfair result, such as the space port being built in a location that is far from most voters.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main advantage of the Condorcet method?

options.label: A
options.text: It is easy to understand and implement.

options.label: B
options.text: It takes into account the full range of people's preferences.

options.label: C
options.text: It gives equal influence to all voters.

options.label: D
options.text: It is resistant to tactical voting.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the main challenge in designing a voting system?

options.label: A
options.text: It is difficult to understand and implement.

options.label: B
options.text: It is impossible to design a voting system that doesn't violate at least some theoretically desirable criteria.

options.label: C
options.text: It is too time-consuming and takes too long to count votes.

options.label: D
options.text: It is biased towards certain geographic locations.

What is the outcome of the musical man's mischief in the studio?

options.label: B
options.text: The musical man is scolded by Vasily Kandinsky

options.label: C
options.text: The musical man's music turns into colors

options.label: D
options.text: The studio is filled with noise

title: Homophone song: There, Their, They're

multiple-choice.question: What are "there" and "there" in the transcript referred to as?
What is the main purpose of the song in the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: To teach the meaning of homophones

options.label: B
options.text: To explain the use of apostrophes

options.label: C
options.text: To help remember the difference between "there" and "their"

options.label: D
options.text: To provide a fun way to learn about grammar rules

multiple-choice.question: What does the transcript suggest should be done when there is confusion about the use of "there" and "their"?

options.label: A
options.text: Look up the definition in a dictionary

options.label: B
options.text: Ask a teacher or tutor for help

options.label: C
options.text: Use the cheesy song to remember the difference

options.label: D
options.text: Just ignore the confusion and move on

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between a contraction and a combined word, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: A contraction is a word with multiple syllables, while a combined word is a single syllable

options.label: B
options.text: A contraction is a word that uses an apostrophe, while a combined word does not

options.label: C
options.text: A contraction is a word that combines two words, while a combined word is a single word

options.label: D
options.text: A contraction is a word that is pronounced differently, while a combined word is pronounced the same

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of using an apostrophe to combine two words, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: A contraction is formed, which is a single word

options.label: B
options.text: A combined word is formed, which is a single word

options.label: C
options.text: A homophone is formed, which is a word that sounds the same but has a different meaning

options.label: D
options.text: A homograph is formed, which is a word that is spelled the same but has a different meaning
